title: Mobile-Based Accounting Science Learning Intensive Short Course: Inquiry Through Experimental Design and Variable Control

context.prior_knowledge: Basic accounting concepts, foundational math skills (calculations/formula application), and understanding of scientific inquiry methods (hypothesis formulation, variable identification, experimental design)
context.additional_context: Short-term intensive course in smartphone-centric environments. Learners reconstruct daily-life examples into math-based accounting data using scientific observation (data collection-pattern analysis) and experimental design principles (control variable setting-result measurement). Emphasizes evidence collection, analysis, and interpretation skills.

learning_goals: Learners solve accounting problems based on mathematical measurements and scientific analysis in mobile environments with ≥80% accuracy.

Learners demonstrate the ability to deconstruct complex accounting concepts step-by-step and control key variables using scaffolding strategies that apply the scientific inquiry method (hypothesis formulation–variable control–data analysis–conclusion).

Learners achieve an average score of ≥75/100 in summative assessments applying experimental design principles (control vs. experimental group comparison, evidence-based conclusions) within one week, demonstrating improved accounting learning outcomes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Easy - Simple structure with minimal constraints
